channel.title: How do i store a variable publicaly
channel.description:
Ok so in a case u can't use public string or void document wondering the following
In case 139 which is a right click option, how can I make it save the other players name as a variable for use in another file like clickingmost,
Then if I do do that how can I call that variable in clickingmost.

item.title: How do i store a variable publicaly
item.dc:creator: @yugioh101 yugioh101
item.description:
@yugioh101 wrote:

ok im making a moderator controllpannel,

to open the controllpannel you rightclick on someone and hit player options as a click option that i put it, now when i do that it stores the name but i cannot access it from anyware except from inside case 139: or whatever i said,

what i want to do is be able to click the button in my modcp and have it do what it says to the player,

eg they press the kick button, it kicks the player,

get it?

but im guessing inorder to do that i need the players name to be stored in a public variable that is accessable outside of that case.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i store a variable publicaly

item.description:
@yugioh101 wrote:

yes but ive never used classes and the main class would go in client.java and i would like it so when i right click there name and select the thing it stores there name for later use in the clickingmost.java file.

how would i make that work in a class?

item.title: How do i store a variable publicaly
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

You mean invoking a method from another class?

Class1:

public class Class1 { // Do stuff. }

Main:

public class Main { public static void main(String[] args){ Class1 method = new Class1(); // Do stuff. }

Something like that?

Read full topic
